page.title: 16C.E. School - Yesteryear
page.content: In 1915 Ravensworth school was a lot different to now. There were 90 children in the old school. There was one small room for the infants and a big room for the juniors. It was heated by an open fire . Children had to walk to school from each village in all kinds of weather. There were few bicycles in those days and children brought their own dinners. The first drink the children had in school was in the winter, when they were given the choice of 'Oxo' or 'Horlicks'. If anyone was naughty they got the cane. The children stayed at school until they were 14. Every week a man went round to find out why anyone was off, he was known as the {'Kid Catcher'} The parents had to pay for their children to go to school. When the children left school they went into service as maids or farmhands.
